trial_identification.studytitle: Studies of Vitamin D supplements on Calcium Metabolism in Sarcoidosis
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A one year randomised, double-blind placebo-controlled trial to evaluate the effects of vitamin D supplementation on serum calcium, urine calcium, bone turnover and bone density in subjects with sarcoidosis and vitamin D insufficiency.

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Other inflammatory or immune system disorders

interventions.interventions: Weekly oral calciferol 50,000 International Units (IU) for four weeks, then monthly oral calciferol 50,000 International Units (IU) for 11 months.
interventions.comparator: Weekly oral placebo for four weeks, then monthly oral placebo for 11 months.

primaryOutcome.outcome: The difference in the change in serum calcium over 12 months between the two treatment groups.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Serum calcium will be measured at baseline, at weeks 2, 4, 6, 8, 12 and 16, and at months 6, 9, and 12.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: The difference between changes in urine calcium at the spine, proximal femur, and total body over 12 months between the two groups.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured at baseline, at weeks 4 and 16, and at 12 months

secondaryOutcome.outcome: The difference between changes in bone turnover markers at the spine, proximal femur, and total body over 12 months between the two groups.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured at baseline, at weeks 4 and 16, and at 12 months

secondaryOutcome.outcome: The difference between changes in bone density at the spine, proximal femur, and total body over 12 months between the two groups.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured at baseline and at months 6 and 12.

eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Serum creatinine >0.15 mmol/L, nephrocalcinosis, hypercalcaemia (adjusted serum calcium >2.55 mmol/L), concurrent major systemic illness (except for sarcoidosis) including malignancy, established osteoporosis (Bone mineral density T score < -2.5 and a fragility fracture)

trial_design.concealment: Subject numbers allocated by personnel based in a different building and having no contact with study subjects
trial_design.sequence: Computer-generated random numbers in variable blocks
trial_design.designfeatures: The people receiving the treatment (subjects), the people administering the treatment, and the people assessing the outcomes (assessors) will be blinded

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This is a one year study designed to test whether vitamin D supplementation is safe and efficacious for patients with sarcoidosis and low vitamin D levels
ethicsAndSummary.publication: Bolland MJ, Wilsher ML, Grey A, Horne AM, Fenwick S, Gamble GD, Reid IR. Randomised controlled trial of vitamin D supplementation in sarcoidosis. BMJ Open. 2013; 3:e003562.
